Key Match Events: Scotland's openers Michael Jones and George Munsey put on a strong start, with Munsey reverse-slog-sweeping Adil Rashid for four and six
Chris Jordan's second ball is pulled monstrously for six by Michael Jones
Munsey dumps an attempted yorker from Jordan over backward square leg for six
Pre-Game Insights: A washout wouldn’t be the end of the world for either team
Were England to then lose against Australia on Saturday, they could be another washout (never mind another defeat) from elimination
Post-Match Reflections: The umpires have given up the ghost, which means both teams will take a point apiece
It could have been worse for England: their DLS target was 109 from 10 overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland will be back at the Kensington Oval on Thursday for what is a very big game against Namibia
England face Australia here on Saturday
